page.title: 04EDUCATION
page.content: THE SCHOOL IS OVER A HUNDRED YEARS OLD AND WAS STARTED DUE TO THE GENEROSITY OF THE LOCAL SQUIRE, COLONEL WOOD, WHO WAS DISTURBED BY THE DISTANCE THE CHILDREN HAD TO WALK TO GET TO GLASBURY. IT IS A CHURCH AIDED SCHOOL. THE BUILDING CONSISTS OF ONE LONG ROOM WITH A PARTITION, ONE HALF CONTAINS THE JUNIORS AND ONE HALF THE INFANTS, APPROXIMATELY A DOZEN OF EACH. THERE IS A VERY SMALL KITCHEN AND TOILET BLOCK ATTACHED. THE PLAY AREA IS CONCRETED WITH SWINGS AND CLIMBING BAR. MOST CHILDREN COME FROM THE VILLAGE OF VELINDRE AND TRANSFER TO THE LOCAL HIGH SCHOOL OF GWERNYFED. PERIPATETIC STAFF VISIT TO EXTEND THE CURRICULUM AND OFFER WELSH, VIOLIN AND READING TUITION. A RURAL SCHOOLS PROJECT WHERE MANY LOCAL SCHOOLS COMBINE FOR VARYING EVENTS ALSO ADDS INTEREST.
